name: Tampere
fun_fact: Fun fact: Tampere is Finland's sauna capital with over 20 public saunas, and was the first Nordic city to have electric lighting for everyone in 1882. It's also the birthplace of Finnish ice hockey (1926) and was the site of a historic 1905 meeting attended by Vladimir Lenin!

hero_dishes.name: Mustamakkara (Black Blood Sausage)
hero_dishes.description: A dark, juicy blood sausage made from pork blood, pork meat, barley, and rye flour. The sausage has a crisp casing and a rich, savory center. It's a proud symbol of Finnish culinary heritage.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Known to have been eaten as early as the 17th century, mustamakkara production started at the end of the 19th century. While available across Finland, it's considered Tampere's specialty and regional pride. The traditional preparation involves smoking or cooking over fire. In Tampere, there's even a unique custom of buying sausage by monetary amount rather than weight!
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Tammelantori Market Square (vendors sell hot, freshly cooked mustamakkara), Laukontori Market Square, Kauppahalli (Tampere Market Hall - especially Lihakipparit meat store), Mustamakkarabaari in Lielahti suburb (authentic production site with gluten-free options on Fridays), Tapola and Savupojat (the two major producers)

signature_drinks.name: Milk with Mustamakkara
signature_drinks.description: Cold milk served alongside black sausage - the traditional pairing
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Black sausage is traditionally eaten with milk, creating a classic sweet-and-savory Finnish combination. Lactose-free milk is also widely available.

signature_drinks.name: Finnish Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Light roast coffee consumed in massive quantities
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Finns drink more coffee per capita than any other nation - it's a cornerstone of daily life
